definition: to fight/to combat/to seize/(of heart) to beat
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb

sentences.english: We could seetheblood vesselsinhis temple pulsate ashe became more angry.
sentences.chinese: 我們可以看到血管搏動他的廟宇，他變得更加憤怒。

sentences.english: Aex beat enlargement and left-downward displacement.
sentences.chinese: 心尖搏動範圍擴大，向左下移位。

sentences.english: We should count time by heart-throb.
sentences.chinese: 我們應當按心臟的搏動來計算時間。

sentences.english: My head throbs behind my eyes and in the temple.
sentences.chinese: 我的眼睛後方和太陽穴有搏動的感覺。

sentences.english: His works are vulnerable, and incredibly expressive vibrations of the soul.
sentences.chinese: 在他的作品中我感知到了細膩，脆弱，和靈魂的搏動。

sentences.english: The sick cow frequently attempts urination and pulsates the urethra over the ischium arch.
sentences.chinese: 病牛頻頻企圖排尿，搏動坐骨弓上的尿道。

sentences.english: The sick cow frequently attempts urination and pulsates the urethra over the ischium arch.
sentences.chinese: 病牛頻頻企圖排尿，坐骨弓上的尿道發生搏動。

sentences.english: Compare oximeter pulse rate with client's radial pulse.
sentences.chinese: 對比血氧計脈率與病人橈動脈搏動。

sentences.english: Press the CCA is proved to be relative with recovery of pulsating exophthalmos.
sentences.chinese: 搏動性突眼的恢復與壓迫頸總動脈有關。
心電圖儀能記錄心臟的搏動。

sentences.english: The clistressed cow frequently attempts urination and pulsates the urethra over the ischial arch.
sentences.chinese: 病牛頻頻企圖排尿，坐骨弓上的尿道發生搏動。

sentences.english: The JVP waves should be timed with simultaneous palpation of the carotid artery.
sentences.chinese: 計算頸靜脈搏動時應同步觸診頸動脈。

sentences.english: There is another heart that beats just like yours.
sentences.chinese: 還有另一顆心跟你的有着一樣的搏動。

sentences.english: One star-brighter than the other, Two Hearts-beating for each other.
sentences.chinese: 一顆特別明亮的星，兩顆爲彼此共同搏動的心。

sentences.english: Vital statistics The Total Artificial Heart has a fixed rate of 125 beats per minute.
sentences.chinese: 全人工心臟一分鐘搏動125下。

definition: body palpation (diagnostic method in TCM)/tactile examination
lit. to breathe out stale air and breathe in fresh (idiom, from Zhuangzi 庄子); fig. to get rid of the old and bring in the new
popliteal (anatomy)/hollow at the back of the knee
